snippet: The mission would be part of the Pentagon’s evolving national security strategy to build counterterrorism capacity among local forces in allied nations, American officials said.
abstract: United States military is considering mission to train Libyan security personnel with goal of creating force of 5,000 to 7,000 conventional soldiers and separate, smaller unit for specialized counterterrorism missions; plan would be part of Pentagon’s evolving national security strategy to build counterterrorism capacity among local forces in allied nations.
lead_paragraph: The mission would be part of the Pentagon’s evolving national security strategy to build counterterrorism capacity among local forces in allied nations, American officials said.
